name: xanthene
Reason: 1,2-propanediol, 3-(2-methoxyphenoxy)-, 1-carbam has a melting point that we can compare to xanthene, which has a melting point of -109.4 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for our comparison will be benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of two additional phenyl rings. Phenyl groups, when connected to a benzene ring, tend to increase the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight. In the case of xanthene, we have two additional phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion, which would notably augment the melting point. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight.
